data.title: rooftop fun!
data.text: The atmosphere is great when the weather is nice. Rooftop downtown creates a hip ambiance. They have a good selection of craft beer and featured drinks. Live music was a really nice addition too.

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: It's a good place to meet friends. I especially like the upstairs area, as long as the music isn't too LOUD that you can't converse!

data.title: Nice place to spend an evening
data.text: We enjoy the rooftop bar area.  This restaurant is just 1 block from the downtown square.  Great variety of Pizza Pi (get it?) and many spirits to choose from.  The menu is not limited to Pizza other items to pick from as well.  Rooftop entertainment on weekends with dancing under the stars, A favorite hangout for many locals and tourists. There is a parking lot across the street and also street parking available.

data.title: Great dishes!
data.text: Pi is a great place to go for a good meal then upstairs on the deck to view downtown while enjoying  music and friends.

data.title: Pizza, beer, and music
data.text: If you are planning to just hang back, have some good pizza, various small brew beers, and some awesome chats and background music This is IT!  Upstairs is definitely louder and more for moving about, We like the downstairs to not be bombarded with it all

data.title: Great 1/2 price pizza on Tuesdays
data.text: Nice selection of craft beers. Upstairs, bar, good music &  party under the stars. Great atmosphere. The pizza is not your typical fat laden, & filling style. Sandwiches & appetizers are also worth a try. It is not open on Mondays.

data.title: The spot to be!
data.text: If you want a fresh experience you're not soon t forget, swing by Pi on Broadway in the Heart of Downtown Town Ocala. Skip Harry's. Melting Pot is for the birds!!! Don't take a chance on any old place. Go to Pi. Never a disappointment. Great place, Warm atmosphere, great views, & amazing brews. Stop by, you can thank me later.

data.title: Want to relax, or party?
data.text: Excellent food and drink for either experience! Downstairs is cozy and quiet enjoying the smell of the food as it cooks.  Upstairs is the party on the roof with the bar and entertainment. Lively atmosphere and the place is usually packed...so if you want to party, get to know someone new...it's the place to be.  Favorites there include beers and wine from local establishments Infinity Aleworks and Corkscrew respectively, and you can't go wrong with any of their flatbreads! Kid and parent favorite appetizer is their AMAZING mac-n-cheese.  Oh my! Reason it gets a four/five is the building (is older), which is nice, but needs repairs. Don't go when it's raining- lots of leaks.... Unless they have fixed them...which is very possible 😀

data.title: Great place to hang out with friends of any age
data.text: We go there every once in a while, nice ambiance, friendly staff, really good pizzas. A great place to go and spend some time chatting with your friends and not leave with empty pockets.

data.title: Great selection, casual dining
data.text: Good times (and eats) were had by all. We joined a big group for dinner, and everyone had something different, and each were signing its praises. Highly recommended....

data.title: I love the rooftop bar and scene!
data.text: I love the rooftop bar and scene! The atmosphere is laid back and music is always jamming at Pi on Broadway!!

data.title: Pretty good food, great delivery service
data.text:
We ate a White Pi from here last night. These guys deliver by bike (tricycle) but it was raining so the deliverer drove.
The pizza was ok, but not as amazing as I had expected for as much as my friend raves about this place. I must admit, she usually gets another type of pizza but I wanted to try the White Pi.
Would order from again while in Ocala.

data.title: The Pi on Broadway
data.text: My guest enjoyed the pizza, I am not much of a pizza eater so I really enjoyed my Jerk Mahi Sandwich. Great side dishes and enjoyable key lime pie.

data.title: speaking as a local.
data.text: Speaking as a local, Pi is fun with friends on a fair weather day....the food is good and so are the drinks.  The roof top bar is the place to be.  Local music that sounds better the more you drink

data.title: Favorite in Ocala
data.text: Pi is without a doubt my favorite place in Ocala.  The changing selection of craft beer is always outstanding, and the bartenders/wait staff are very knowledgeable about the products.  The kitchen is just creative enough, offering appetizers such as homemade Hummus and Caramelized Brussels Sprouts.  Cannot go wrong with the Sonora or Creole Pi (or the build your own if you're not feeling adventurous).  The rooftop is a great place to have a beer or drink and enjoy the entertainment.  Always a safe bet to bring visitors; Pi does not disappoint.

data.title: Great outdoor area
data.text: My wife and I go here when we want to have a drink and enjoy the sunsets in an outdoor rooftop area. Lots of craft beers on tap that you can't get other places.

data.title: Fun place to hang out
data.text: We stopped in here for lunch one day.  We ate on the roof deck and really enjoyed looking out over the downtown area.  Our waiter was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our sandwiches.  They do have pizzas and other pub type food.  I've seen people hanging out here in the evening and I'm sure it's a great place for that.

data.title: Fun place with good atmosphere!
data.text: I went in here for an adult beverage and was pleasantly surprised by live music on the rooftop.  The band played an assortment of songs and genre's and was very entertaining.   The service was good and there was a nice crowd there.  If you're ever in the mood for a nice relaxing drink under the stars while people watching,  this is a great place to do it!

data.title: Pi and a beer
data.text: Excellent pizza's.  I had the Genovese pi with walnuts, goat cheese and pesto, with the pesto liberaly dripping of my pi.  Nice rooftop terras, sometimes with live music.  The real surprise is their generous offer of Belgian specialty beers on tap! Rochefort, Saxon, Delirium Tremens, Duchesse de Bourgogne.  Pricy (paid 7$ for the Duchesse), but yummie.  Will definitely return!
